# Video Demo

![](qdraw-in-use.mp4)


# Installation

``` bash
quarto add mahmudstat/qdraw
```

and add the plugin to your `yaml` in the the following way:

``` yaml
---
title: "Qdraw Example"
format:
  revealjs: default
revealjs-plugins:
  - qdraw
---
```

# Using

- Add your contents to `qmd` file and render.
- Click on the draw icon <i class="fas fa-pen-nib"></i> to activate the drawing tools.
- Click the icon again to hide the tools and move on to the other slides.
- Use the self-explanatory tools as per your requirements.

## Icons

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
- <i style="font-weight: bold; color: red;" class="fas fa-pen-nib"></i> Start/Stop Drawing
- <i style="font-weight: bold;" class="fas fa-marker"></i> Choose to Draw (defaulted initially)
- <i style="font-weight: bold;" class="fas fa-eye-dropper"></i> Change Pen Color
- <i style="font-weight: bold; color: green;" class="fas fa-undo"></i> Undo Drawings
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
- <i style="font-weight: bold; color: red;" class="fas fa-eraser"></i> Erase Drawings
- <i style="font-weight: bold; color: red;" class="fas fa-trash"></i> Delete All Drawings
- <i style="font-weight: bold; color: green;"  class="fas fa-fill-drip"></i> Change Background
- <i style="font-weight: bold; color: red;"  class="fas fa-fill-drip"></i> Reset Background
- <i style="font-weight: bold; color: green;" class="fas fa-download"></i> Download Drawings
:::

::::

## Scatter Plot with Chart.js

(Not part of `qdraw` plugin)

<canvas id="myChart" style="width:100%;max-width:700px"></canvas>

<script>
var xyValues = [
  {x:50, y:7},
  {x:60, y:8},
  {x:70, y:8},
  {x:80, y:9},
  {x:90, y:9},
  {x:100, y:9},
  {x:110, y:10},
  {x:120, y:11},
  {x:130, y:14},
  {x:140, y:14},
  {x:150, y:15}
];

new Chart(document.getElementById("myChart"), {
  type: "scatter",
  data: {
    datasets: [{
      pointRadius: 4,
      pointBackgroundColor: "rgb(0,0,255)",
      data: xyValues
    }]
  },
  options: {
    legend: {display: true},
    scales: {
      xAxes: [{ticks: {min: 40, max:160}}],
      yAxes: [{ticks: {min: 6, max:16}}],
    }
  }
});
</script>
